intro: Leucopogon audax, commonly known as the broad-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and its flowers are usually white or pink, blooming in spring. Leucopogon audax is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
